     function setAttributeOnload(object, attribute, val) {
      if(window.addEventListener) {
        window.addEventListener('load',
          function(){ object[attribute] = val; }, false);
      } else {
        window.attachEvent('onload', function(){ object[attribute] = val; });
      }
    }
    </script>

                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/nullification-vs-constitutional.html">

                     </a>
                    </h3>

                    <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/when-will-we-take-down-these-monuments.html">
                      When Will We Take Down These Monuments Of Slavery?
                     </a>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="post-header">
                     <div class="post-header-line-1">
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-276517154715721979" itemprop="description articleBody">
                     Via Bill
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <a href="http://forums.gunsandammo.com/showthread.php?24795-When-Will-We-Take-Down-These-Monuments-Of-Slavery">
                       Guns &amp; Ammo
                      </a>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <br/>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <img alt="" border="0" height="273" src="http://i898.photobucket.com/albums/ac186/38cal/IMG_0172_zpsat76wnpx.jpg" width="400"/>
                     </div>
                     <div style="clear: both;">
                     </div>
                    </div>

                    <meta content="https://img.washingtonpost.com/rf/image_908w/2010-2019/WashingtonPost/2015/06/22/National-Enterprise/Images/RTX1B0NU.jpg" itemprop="image_url"/>

                    </a>
                    <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/whats-next-confederate-cleansing.html">
                      What's next? Confederate cleansing?
                     </a>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="post-header">
                     <div class="post-header-line-1">
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-4651358152431197687" itemprop="description articleBody">
                     <span style='font-family: Georgia,"Times New Roman",serif;'>
                      <span style="font-size: small;">
                       "Dear Brock -
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                       This is my first transmission to you - but, hopefully not the
      last. I have been a Long Time Reader/Admirer of your
      freenorthcarolina.blogspot page and finally feel I have something
      worthy to pass your way. The text is attached as a word doc, but -
      if you prefer - here is the actual
                       <a href="http://www.roanoke.com/webmin/opinion/what-s-next-confederate-cleansing/article_6b9f1d5b-7589-58f8-834f-7e5e58014d83.html">
                        link
                       </a>
                       .
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                       I was born and reared in Roanoke, VA - about 15 miles or so from
      Boones Mill, VA - but I cannot say I know writer, Mr. John Cahoon.
      However, he is certainly Spot On with his comments -
                       <b>
                        four
        years in advance
                       </b>
                       - and it would be a great pleasure to cross
      his path, just as it would Yours. Though a Virginian by Birth, I
      have been in North Carolina since matriculating to the Dark Blue
      Durham School in 1972 - a school which would, today, shun the
      likes of me (the feeling is mutual, by the way ... see attached).
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                       I thought you would appreciate Mr. Cahoon's writing from 2011 and
      I hope you are able to give it proper distribution with your
      popular website.
                       <u>
                        <i>
                         <b>
                          More importantly, I wanted you to know with
      certainty that there are - indeed - those of us Out There who
      are watching, waiting, and standing by ...
                         </b>
                         <br/>
                        </i>
                       </u>
                       <br/>
                       Please continue to Keep Up Your Good Work and, when time and
      energy permit, let me know how I might be of assistance.
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style='font-family: Georgia,"Times New Roman",serif;'>
                      <span style="font-size: small;">
                       Very Respectfully,
                       <br/>
                       <br/>
                       Rick Hubbard
                       <br/>
                       Terrell, NC
                      </span>
                      <br/>
                      Life Member, NC SCV
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style='font-family: Georgia,"Times New Roman",serif;'>
                      <br/>
                     </span>
                     <span style='font-family: Georgia,"Times New Roman",serif;'>
                      <span style="font-size: small;">
                       Dear Rick,
                      </span>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style='font-family: Georgia,"Times New Roman",serif;'>
                      <span style="font-size: small;">
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </span>
                     <span style='font-family: Georgia,"Times New Roman",serif;'>
                      <span style="font-size: small;">
                       Thank you for your kind words, Sir and we shall continue the fight until we cross over the river.
                      </span>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style='font-family: Georgia,"Times New Roman",serif;'>
                      <span style="font-size: small;">
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </span>
                     <span style='font-family: Georgia,"Times New Roman",serif;'>
                      <span style="font-size: small;">
                       Brock
                      </span>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, serif;">
                      <br/>
                     </span>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, serif;">
                       ******************************************
                       <br/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <img alt="https://img.washingtonpost.com/rf/image_908w/2010-2019/WashingtonPost/2015/06/22/National-Enterprise/Images/RTX1B0NU.jpg" class="shrinkToFit" height="485" src="https://img.washingtonpost.com/rf/image_908w/2010-2019/WashingtonPost/2015/06/22/National-Enterprise/Images/RTX1B0NU.jpg" width="570"/>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <br/>
                      <b>
                       Dated
                      </b>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <br/>
                     </div>
                     <div class="kmn-div" id="kmn_tag_72936424f6f73ff6f0032712a9c8cc7a">
                      <span class="PubAdAI">
                      </span>
                      <br/>
                      <div style="left: 0px; position: absolute; top: 0px; visibility: hidden;">
                       <span class="PubAdAI">
                        <img src="http://uk-ads.openx.net/w/1.0/ri?ee=res&amp;ts=1fHJpZD1kZDgxZjBiMi01Nzg1LTQ1YzYtODM5Ni1kMDhiMzIxYWZmZWN8cnQ9MTQzNjI4NDg4MXxhdWlkPTUzNzE0NzI1NXxhdW09RE1JRC5XRUJ8c2lkPTUzNzEwNjQxMHxwdWI9MTI2Njg2fHBjPVVTRHx4dD1yZXN8cmFpZD1kMTRkZTQzZS0xZjMwLTRlNmUtYTcxOC02MzJkMWM4MzBiNjZ8dXI9YzZwMWhiOVRPcA"/>
                       </span>
                      </div>
                      <span class="PubAdAI">
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     The Lexington City Council, currently under court
 injunction for previous civil rights violations against its own 
residents, has courageously resurrected what appears to be massive 
resistance and embarked on a campaign of Confederate ethnic cleansing in
 order to preserve the Southern way of life based upon viewpoint 
segregation. Thank goodness.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     If not, council members would have to endure the 
integration of different viewpoints within their closed, progressive 
community and be forced to acknowledge as equals those who wish to honor
 the Confederate soldier by displaying the Confederate flag one day of 
the year.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     In a previous narrow escape from having to 
embrace tolerance, inclusiveness and free speech, Lexington fended off 
an attempt to locate the onerous Museum of the Confederacy within their 
community. This would have been a calamity since their community would 
have been exposed to undesirable and contrary viewpoints. Certainly the 
tourist dollars and resulting jobs were inconsequential to the wealthy 
elitists and were not needed by Lexington's unemployed blacks and 
whites.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      More @
                      <a href="http://www.roanoke.com/webmin/opinion/what-s-next-confederate-cleansing/article_6b9f1d5b-7589-58f8-834f-7e5e58014d83.html">
                       The Roanoke Times
                      </a>
                     </div>
                     <div style="clear: both;">
                     </div>

                    <meta content="http://booklife.com/image-factory/http/localhost/amazongetcover/9781590793091.jpg/w204.jpg" itemprop="image_url"/>
                    <meta content="7566715115931065803" itemprop="blogId"/>

                    <a name="783677394537094877">
                    </a>
                    <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/jade-helm-terrorist-attacks.html">
                      Jade Helm, Terrorist Attacks, Surveillance and Other Fairy Tales for a Gullible Nation
                     </a>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="post-header">
                     <div class="post-header-line-1">
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-783677394537094877" itemprop="description articleBody">
                     Via LH
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <img src="http://booklife.com/image-factory/http/localhost/amazongetcover/9781590793091.jpg/w204.jpg"/>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     Strange how paranoia can link up with reality now and then.  Philip K. Dick,
                     <em>
                      A Scanner Darkly
                     </em>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 14px; line-height: 150%; margin: 1em 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: left;">
                      Once upon a time, there was a nation of people who believed everything they were told by their government.
                     </div>
                     <div style="font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 14px; line-height: 150%; margin: 1em 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: left;">
                      When
 terrorists attacked the country, and government officials claimed to 
have been caught by surprise, the people believed them. And when the 
government passed massive laws aimed at locking down the nation and 
opening the door to total government surveillance, the people believed 
it was done merely to keep them safe. The few who disagreed were labeled
 traitors.
                     </div>
                     <div style="font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 14px; line-height: 150%; margin: 1em 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: left;">
                      When
 the government waged costly preemptive wars on foreign countries, 
insisting it was necessary to protect the nation, the citizens believed 
it. And when the government brought the weapons and tactics of war home 
to use against the populace, claiming it was just a way to recycle old 
equipment, the people believed that too. The few who disagreed were 
labeled unpatriotic.
                     </div>
                     <div style="color: #505050; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 14px; line-height: 150%; margin: 1em 0px; padding: 0px; text-align: center;">
                      <span style="color: white;">
                       More @
                      </span>
                      <a href="http://us4.campaign-archive1.com/?u=f6eb78f457b7b82887b643445&amp;id=e9862ecce2&amp;e=453e3b50f0">
                       John W. Whitehead
                      </a>
                     </div>
                     <div style="clear: both;">
                     </div>
                    </div>

                  <div class="post-outer">
                   <div class="post hentry" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                    <meta content="https://governedbymorons.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/bastiat1a1.jpg" itemprop="image_url"/>
                    <meta content="7566715115931065803" itemprop="blogId"/>
                    <meta content="8219904079058796670" itemprop="postId"/>
                    <a name="8219904079058796670">
                    </a>
                    <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/why-frederic-bastiat-still-matters.html">
                      Why Frdric Bastiat Still Matters
                     </a>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="post-header">
                     <div class="post-header-line-1">
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-8219904079058796670" itemprop="description articleBody">
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span class="topictitle">
                       <img alt="https://governedbymorons.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/bastiat1a1.jpg" height="240" src="https://governedbymorons.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/bastiat1a1.jpg" width="400"/>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <br/>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span class="topictitle">
                       <a class="topictitle" href="http://www.namsouth.com/viewtopic.php?t=2366&amp;highlight=bastiat">
                        The Law By Frederic Bastiat
                       </a>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <span class="topictitle">
                       <b>
                        Some freebies above.
                       </b>
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <br/>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: left;">
                      <span class="topictitle">
                      </span>
                      <span class="topictitle">
                       Yesterday marked the 214
                       <sup>
                        th
                       </sup>
                       anniversary of Frdric 
Bastiats birthday on June 30, 1801, in Bayonne, France. One of the 
seminal thinkers of the classical liberal tradition, Bastiat made great 
contributions to the field of political economy, laying many of the 
foundations for the later school of Austrian economics. Both a 
politician and a writer, Bastiat penned numerous books and essays on 
political economy and how its principles could be applied to mid-19
                       <sup>
                        th
                       </sup>
                       century France, writing with his razor-sharp wit and renowned 
rhetorical flair. While his works pertain to post-Napoleonic France, 
they carry important lessons for our nations leaders, politicians, and 
economists.
                      </span>
                     </div>
                     <div style="text-align: left;">
                      <br/>
                     </div>
                     One of Bastiats most important lessons appears in
                     <a href="http://bastiat.org/en/twisatwins.html">
                      <em>
                       That Which is Seen, and That Which is Not Seen
                      </em>
                     </a>
                     ,
 where Bastiat applied his careful method of logical procession to 
economic questions. In this work, he examines the same topics that are 
commonly misunderstood by contemporary politicians: military spending, 
taxes, the economic benefits of saving, and mechanization, among others.
 In each examination, he demonstrates that the economist or policy maker
 must look beyond the apparent to understand the true effects of a 
policy, showing in every case that the arguments for government 
intervention are inherently flawed. If one were to apply this method to 
the argument for raising the minimum wage to $15, for example, one would
 see that the unseen effects, the firing of low-skill workers and 
increased prices, are damaging. It is this logical method that informed 
many in the Austrian school of thought and formed the foundation of 
Henry Hazlitts seminal
                     <a href="http://www.independent.org/store/book.asp?id=91">
                      <em>
                       Economics in One Lesson
                      </em>
                     </a>
                     , which is a more thorough investigation of Bastiats principle.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      More @
                      <a href="http://blog.independent.org/2015/07/01/why-frederic-bastiat-still-matters/">
                       The Independent Institute
                      </a>
                     </div>
                     <div style="clear: both;">
                     </div>
                    </div>

                  <div class="post-outer">
                   <div class="post hentry" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                    <meta content="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NOpG0F3cEwM/VZvw6wEit6I/AAAAAAAAJBI/DN973IeL5vc/s400/CONNOR070615.jpg" itemprop="image_url"/>
                    <meta content="7566715115931065803" itemprop="blogId"/>
                    <meta content="2220582326212126339" itemprop="postId"/>
                    <a name="2220582326212126339">
                    </a>
                    <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/honoring-our-forefathers-heritage-of.html">
                      Honoring our Forefathers: The heritage of the South, symbolized by the Confederate Battle Flag, is so important to many
                     </a>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="post-header">
                     <div class="post-header-line-1">
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-2220582326212126339" itemprop="description articleBody">
                     Via LH
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
                       <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NOpG0F3cEwM/VZvw6wEit6I/AAAAAAAAJBI/DN973IeL5vc/s1600/CONNOR070615.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">
                        <img border="0" height="237" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NOpG0F3cEwM/VZvw6wEit6I/AAAAAAAAJBI/DN973IeL5vc/s400/CONNOR070615.jpg" width="400"/>
                       </a>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     Like nearly all South Carolinians, I was deeply saddened upon 
learning of the senseless murders at the Emmanuel AME Church in 
Charleston, S.C. At the time, I was serving (military duties) outside 
the state when I also learned one of the slain was related to a fellow 
soldier.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     I continue to pray for the families. Their Christian witness after the tragedy impacted us all.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     For
 the sake of respect for the victims and their families, I did not 
believe it appropriate to write an article in response to the 
Confederate flag issue in the immediate aftermath of the tragedy; not 
during the period for mourning. I had to pray about timing, as I wanted 
nothing I said to detract from the care of the families. However, now 
that we have had an opportunity to grieve (and with the recent U.S. 
Supreme Court gay marriage decision undermining states 10th Amendment 
powers), I feel compelled to offer a contrasting view about the 
Confederate Battle Flag.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      More @
                      <a href="http://canadafreepress.com/print-friendly/73523">
                       Canada Free Press
                      </a>
                     </div>
                     <div style="clear: both;">
                     </div>
                    </div>

                  <div class="post-outer">
                   <div class="post hentry" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                    <meta content="http://www.independent.org/images/email/2015/love_gov_lh_492x134.png" itemprop="image_url"/>
                    <meta content="7566715115931065803" itemprop="blogId"/>
                    <meta content="2182578367322939127" itemprop="postId"/>
                    <a name="2182578367322939127">
                    </a>
                    <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/independent-institute-love-gov-video.html">
                      Independent Institute: Love Gov Video Series Satirizes Intrusive Government
                     </a>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="post-header">
                     <div class="post-header-line-1">
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-2182578367322939127" itemprop="description articleBody">
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <img border="0" src="http://www.independent.org/images/email/2015/love_gov_lh_492x134.png"/>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     The United States just celebrated 239 years of independence from 
England, but have Americans become too dependent on Washington, D.C.? 
And what does it meanin human termswhen we say that the federal 
government has become too involved in the lives of young adults? Rather 
than address the question with numbers and graphs, we thought it would 
be more memorable (and entertaining) to tell you the story of Alexis 
Smithan idealistic college student who falls for Scott Gov Govinsky 
in
                     <a href="http://www.independent.org/lovegov/">
                      <em>
                       Love Gov
                      </em>
                     </a>
                     , a satirical video series from Independent Institute that weve just released on YouTube
                     <em>
                      .
                     </em>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     Each of the series five episodes follows Alexiss relationship with
 Gov, a confident young man whose good intentions wreak (comic) havoc 
on her life. Watch Alexis as she deals with excessive student debt, 
costly housing, underemployment, bureaucratic healthcare, and more. 
Alexiss loyal friend Libby tries to help her see Gov for what he really
 isa menace. But will Alexis come to her senses in time? Tune in to 
find out!
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     
                     <em>
                      Love Gov
                     </em>
                     is a way to help anyone, especially Millennials, 
understand the federal governments ever-expanding reach into personal 
lives, says David J. Theroux, founder and president of Independent 
Institute. Its a lighthearted approach to reach audiences on a 
personal level, and inspire them to learn more and take action.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     The
                     <em>
                      Love Gov
                     </em>
                     video series also connects with the updated
                     <a href="http://www.mygovcost.org/mobileapp/">
                      MyGovCost mobile app
                     </a>
                     ,
 a tool that helps users estimate their lifetime federal tax liability, 
their contribution to 17 federal spending categories, and the amount of 
money they would have accumulated if they had invested the money they 
paid to the U.S. Treasury and earned a modest six percent return.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <a href="http://www.independent.org/lovegov/">
                       <em>
                        Love Gov: From First Date to Mandate
                       </em>
                      </a>
                     </div>
                     <div style="clear: both;">
                     </div>
                    </div>

                   <div class="post hentry" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                    <meta content="http://mediaassets.commercialappeal.com/photo/2015/07/06/wire_flag_20929558_ver1.0_640_480.jpg" itemprop="image_url"/>
                    <meta content="7566715115931065803" itemprop="blogId"/>
                    <meta content="2462084938387832875" itemprop="postId"/>
                    <a name="2462084938387832875">
                    </a>
                    <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/mississippi-flag-supporters-rally.html">
                      Mississippi flag supporters rally outside state Capitol
                     </a>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="post-header">
                     <div class="post-header-line-1">
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-2462084938387832875" itemprop="description articleBody">
                     Via Billy
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <img class="image" height="266" src="http://mediaassets.commercialappeal.com/photo/2015/07/06/wire_flag_20929558_ver1.0_640_480.jpg" width="400"/>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     The Confederate battle emblem should remain on the Mississippi flag 
because it honors ancestors who fought for the South in the Civil War, a
 brother of former Gov. Haley Barbour told about 40 supporters of the 
state banner at a rally Monday outside the state Capitol.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     They 
were fighting for the freedom of the South not to get bossed around by a
 bunch of Yankees, Jeppie Barbour told reporters after he spoke on the 
Capitol steps.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      More @
                      <a href="http://www.commercialappeal.com/news/local-news/southeast/mississippi-flag-supporters-rally-outside-state-capitol_29554458">
                       The Commercial Appeal
                      </a>
                     </div>
                     <div style="clear: both;">
                     </div>

                   <div class="post hentry" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                    <meta content="https://rasica.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/sinaiegypteng.jpg?w=547" itemprop="image_url"/>
                    <meta content="7566715115931065803" itemprop="blogId"/>
                    <meta content="6228552213511683540" itemprop="postId"/>
                    <a name="6228552213511683540">
                    </a>
                    <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/egypts-new-presidents-forces-kills-241.html">
                      Egypts New President's Forces Kills 241 NWO ISIS Terrorists In 5 Days
                     </a>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="post-header">
                     <div class="post-header-line-1">
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-6228552213511683540" itemprop="description articleBody">
                     Via comment by Anonymous on
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/appalachian-messenger-july-3rd.html">
                      Appalachian Messenger July 3rd
                     </a>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <img alt="Sinai Egypt" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-105599" src="https://rasica.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/sinaiegypteng.jpg?w=547"/>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     Clashes between the armed forces and militants in North Sinai since 
the beginning of July left 241 [ISIS mercenary] militants dead, said 
military spokesman Mohamed Samir in an official statement on Monday.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     The statement further read that a total of 33 people were arrested, 
out of whom 29 were suspects. The armed forces statement accompanied 
photos of killed militants with camouflage gears.
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      More @
                      <a href="http://politicalvelcraft.org/2015/07/06/egypts-new-president-kills-241nwo-isis-terrorists-in-5-days/">
                       Political Vel Craft
                      </a>
                     </div>

                  <div class="post-outer">
                   <div class="post hentry" itemprop="blogPost" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting">
                    <meta content="7566715115931065803" itemprop="blogId"/>
                    <meta content="6334910871036576636" itemprop="postId"/>
                    <a name="6334910871036576636">
                    </a>
                    <h3 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name">
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/illegal-alien-francisco-sanchez-coached.html">
                      Illegal alien Francisco Sanchez coached to say he feels sorry for murdering Kate Steinle at San Francisco pier
                     </a>
                    </h3>
                    <div class="post-header">
                     <div class="post-header-line-1">
                     </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-6334910871036576636" itemprop="description articleBody">
                     Via comment by Anonymous on
                     <a href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/2015/07/a-muslim-beats-dutch-girl-in-holland.html">
                      A Muslim Beats a Dutch Girl in Holland
                     </a>
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      <iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="210" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PbJ_6o4c5Vk" width="280">
                      </iframe>
                     </div>
                     <br/>
                     MUST WATCH! (ACTUAL SPANISH DOES NOT MATCH ENGLISH TRANSLATION BY TV NEWS)
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     From Eric Dondero:
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     Headlines in San Francisco media, and even across the country this morning, that the killer of Kate Steinle feels regret over shooting her while she was walking with her Dad on SF's famed Pier 14 last week. But pay careful attention to the video interview in the jail cell.(Relevant portion starts at the 17 minute mark. The precise moment is at the 18 minute mark - listen to how the the interpreter asks him "te sientes mal"? Do you feel bad? His response of "No" - shaking his head from side-to-side is crystal clear. )
                     <br/>
                     <br/>
                     <div style="text-align: center;">
                      More @
                      <a href="http://www.libertarianrepublican.net/2015/07/tv-reporter-interpreter-coach-illegal.html?m=1">
                       Libertarian Republican
                      </a>
                     </div>
                     <div style="clear: both;">
                     </div>
                    </div>

               <div class="widget HTML" id="HTML3">
                <h2 class="title">
                 Core Creek Militia
                </h2>
                <div class="widget-content">
                 <span class="postbody">
                  <a class="postlink" href="http://www.postimage.org/image.php?v=gxLmgOr" target="_blank">
                   <img border="0" src="http://s1.postimage.org/LmgOr.jpg"/>
                  </a>
                 </span>
                 ==============================
                 <a href="http://www.namsouth.com/viewtopic.php?t=119&amp;highlight=koonce">
                  <span class="postbody">
                   My sixth great grandfather
                  </span>
                 </a>
                 <span class="postbody">
                  , his wife, and five of his six children were killed in battle with the Tuscarora Indians at Core Creek, NC.
                 </span>
                </div>
                <div class="clear">
                </div>
                <span class="widget-item-control">
                 <span class="item-control blog-admin">
                  <a class="quickedit" href="//www.blogger.com/rearrange?blogID=7566715115931065803&amp;widgetType=HTML&amp;widgetId=HTML3&amp;action=editWidget&amp;sectionId=sidebar-right-1" onclick='return _WidgetManager._PopupConfig(document.getElementById("HTML3"));' target="configHTML3" title="Edit">

                  </a>
                 </span>
                </span>
                <div class="clear">
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="widget HTML" id="HTML4">
                <h2 class="title">
                 The Seven Blackbirds
                </h2>
                <div class="widget-content">
                 <iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="300" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/e9pCK-r-QMg" title="YouTube video player" width="300">
                 </iframe>
                 <a href="http://www.namsouth.com/viewtopic.php?t=42&amp;highlight=pippen">
                  ==============================My
                  <span class="postbody">
                   third great grandfather
                  </span>
                 </a>
                 <span class="postbody">
                  was an Ensign in the Revolutionary War, and saved his unit's flag after being wounded at the Battle of Brandywine. He was also at Kingston (Kinston), Wilmington, Charleston, Two Sisters and Augusta.   He was at the defeat at Brier Creek and also Bee Creek.
                 </span>
                </div>
                <div class="clear">
                </div>
                <span class="widget-item-control">
                 <span class="item-control blog-admin">
                  <a class="quickedit" href="//www.blogger.com/rearrange?blogID=7566715115931065803&amp;widgetType=HTML&amp;widgetId=HTML4&amp;action=editWidget&amp;sectionId=sidebar-right-1" onclick='return _WidgetManager._PopupConfig(document.getElementById("HTML4"));' target="configHTML4" title="Edit">
                   <img alt="" height="18" src="//img1.blogblog.com/img/icon18_wrench_allbkg.png" width="18"/>
                  </a>
                 </span>
                </span>
                <div class="clear">
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="widget HTML" id="HTML2">
                <h2 class="title">
                 53rd North Carolina, Fort Mahone/ "Fort Damnation" Petersburg, Virginia
                </h2>
                <div class="widget-content">
                 <object height="300" width="300">
                  <param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/rwcuk-03uOw?fs=1&amp;hl=en_US&amp;rel=0">
                  </param>
                  <param name="allowFullScreen" value="true">
                  </param>
                  <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always">
                  </param>
                  <embed allowfullscreen="true" allowscriptaccess="always" height="200" src="http://www.youtube.com/v/rwcuk-03uOw?fs=1&amp;hl=en_US&amp;rel=0" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width='190"'>
                  </embed>
                 </object>
                 <span style="font-weight:bold;">
                  Requiem Aeternam -  
Eternal Rest Grant unto Them
                 </span>
                 ==============================
                 <a href="http://www.namsouth.com/viewtopic.php?t=41&amp;highlight=koonce">
                  My second great grandfather
                 </a>
                 was killed in action on May 3, 1863 at the Battle of Chancellorsville.
                 <small>
                  <a href="http://tinyurl.com/4kf5u9h" target="_blank">
                  </a>
                 </small>
                 =============================
                 <a href="http://www.namsouth.com/viewtopic.php?t=588&amp;highlight=leach">
                  My great grandfather
                 </a>
                 and great uncle knew all the men in the "Civil War Requiem" video as they were part of the 53rd NC which was the sole unit defending Fort Mahone. (Fort Mahone was named "Fort Damnation" by the Yankees) *Handpicked men of the 53rd (My great grandfather was one of these) made the final, night assault at Petersburg in an attempt to break Grant's line. This was against Fort Stedman which was a few miles to the slight northeast. They initially succeeded, but reinforcements drove them back. This video is made from photographs which were taken the day after the 53rd evacuated the lines the night before to begin the retreat to Appomattox. I have many more pictures taken by the same photographer, one of these shows a 14 year old boy and the other is the famous picture of the blond, handsome soldier with his musket.

===========================

*General Gordon promised the men a gold medal and 30 days leave if they accomplished their task and many years after the War my great grandfather wrote General Gordon, who was then governor of Georgia about this incident.  They exchanged several letters which I have framed. See first link below.

===========================

*
                 <a href="http://tinyurl.com/27jg5dt">
                  The Attack On Fort Stedman
                 </a>
                 ============================
                 <a href="http://tinyurl.com/2urzt3e">
                  "His Colored Friends"
                 </a>
                 ============================
                 <a href="http://tinyurl.com/3ypcjt2">
                  Lee's Surrender
                 </a>
                 =============================
                 <a href="http://tinyurl.com/32h94vp">
                  My Black NC Kinfolks
                 </a>
                 ============================
                 <a href="http://tinyurl.com/39cb67b">
                  Punished For Being Caught!
                 </a>
                </div>
                <div class="clear">
                </div>
                <span class="widget-item-control">
                 <span class="item-control blog-admin">
                  <a class="quickedit" href="//www.blogger.com/rearrange?blogID=7566715115931065803&amp;widgetType=HTML&amp;widgetId=HTML2&amp;action=editWidget&amp;sectionId=sidebar-right-1" onclick='return _WidgetManager._PopupConfig(document.getElementById("HTML2"));' target="configHTML2" title="Edit">
                   <img alt="" height="18" src="//img1.blogblog.com/img/icon18_wrench_allbkg.png" width="18"/>
                  </a>
                 </span>
                </span>
                <div class="clear">
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="widget HTML" id="HTML8">
                <h2 class="title">
                 Great Grandfather Koonce
                </h2>
                <div class="widget-content">
                 He was a drummer boy in the WBTS, survived the War only to die a few years later.  He was caught in an ice storm on his way home, but instead of seeking shelter, continued on his horse until the end.  His clothes had to be cut off and he died a few days later.
                </div>
                <div class="clear">
                </div>
                <span class="widget-item-control">
                 <span class="item-control blog-admin">
                  <a class="quickedit" href="//www.blogger.com/rearrange?blogID=7566715115931065803&amp;widgetType=HTML&amp;widgetId=HTML8&amp;action=editWidget&amp;sectionId=sidebar-right-1" onclick='return _WidgetManager._PopupConfig(document.getElementById("HTML8"));' target="configHTML8" title="Edit">
                   <img alt="" height="18" src="//img1.blogblog.com/img/icon18_wrench_allbkg.png" width="18"/>
                  </a>
                 </span>
                </span>
                <div class="clear">

                <div class="widget-content">
                 <span style="font-size:100%;">
                  <a bk="28.1" bns="API" href="http://rds.yahoo.com/_ylt=A0PDoX7BVvVMa28AUBKJzbkF;_ylu=X3oDMTBqcGowaXYwBHBvcwMzMwRzZWMDc3IEdnRpZAM-/SIG=1kuegmlip/EXP=1291233345/**http%3a//images.search.yahoo.com/images/view%3fback=http%253A%252F%252Fimages.search.yahoo.com%252Fsearch%252Fimages%253F_adv_prop%253Dimage%2526b%253D22%2526ni%253D21%2526va%253Ddon%252Bwilliams%2526xargs%253D0%2526pstart%253D1%2526fr%253Dgreentree_ff1%26w=200%26h=198%26imgurl=www.onlineseats.com%252Fupload%252Fconcerts%252F960_con_don-williams2.jpg%26rurl=http%253A%252F%252Fwww.onlineseats.com%252Fdon-williams-tickets%252Findex.asp%26size=11KB%26name=Don%2bWilliams%2bTic...%26p=don%2bwilliams%26oid=2fe4ccd40b62e89bc1e44ad0a3dc0fda%26fr2=%26no=33%26tt=455000%26b=22%26ni=21%26sigr=11pe4h15j%26sigi=11tam4rag%26sigb=13p4ic04o%26.crumb=ZLOnS4jR7Et">
                   <iframe frameborder="0" height="300" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/uzGx_XzxDeM?rel=0" title="YouTube video player" width="300">
                   </iframe>

                     </a>
                     <a class="post-count-link" href="http://freenorthcarolina.blogspot.com/search?updated-min=2015-01-01T00:00:00-05:00&amp;updated-max=2016-01-01T00:00:00-05:00&amp;max-results=50">

                      </li>
                     </ul>

               <div class="widget Text" id="Text4">
                <h2 class="title">
                 Thank you
                </h2>
                <div class="widget-content">
                 I would just like you to know how so very glad I am that I found your blog. I have learned more history from you and the many links that you post than I have from reading all my history books. I can never thank you enough for the education you are freely giving me. It is priceless. And eye opening.
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 Many times I will not comment, but that does not mean I am not reading and learning.
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 You sir, are an educator. Thank you.
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 Phyllis
                 <br/>
                 Wantage, NJ
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 Good morning Mr. Townsend,
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 Just to let you know I have finally finished that massive tome on General Lee. I never knew 1/10th of what a great man he was. No wonder the South is so proud of him! So sad that we have few men of his caliber today. We need them desperately. I have learned more history through you and your blog than  I thought I could ever learn. I am very grateful to you. Thank you so much for taking time to answer my e-mail. And thank you for your blog and for opening my eyes.
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 Phyllis
                 <br/>
                 Wantage, NJ
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 ".......So good to hear from you! And also so pleased you are converting more  of us Yankees! You have no idea how many people you have taught. And  how many are so grateful to you for showing us the truth."
                 <p>
                  Your faithful friend,
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Phylis
                  <br/>
                 </p>
                 ==============================
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 <div class="cgXMmc">
                  <div class="vFgtwf">
                   I  have also learned from Brock Townsend and two nurses lately, that  appreciation expressed by someone for whom you have great respect  overwhelms the lack of appreciation by some from whom you expect it.  I  believe that we cannot really know which small bit of help makes the  life-saving difference.  
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <a class="Sg Ob qm" href="https://plus.google.com/u/0/106413706451869738876" rel="nofollow">
                  Horace Smith
                 </a>
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 ==============================
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 <div>
                  <cite>
                   <a href="http://www.blogger.com/profile/17649363195230989320" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
                    Conan the Cimmerian, King of Aquilonia
                   </a>
                  </cite>
                  <span>
                  </span>
                 </div>
                 <p>
                  It is an honor to be linked by one of the best liberty/Southron blogs. Your blog is a multi-daily must read.
                  <br/>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  ==============================
                 </p>
                 <div class="comment-header" id="bc_0_1M" kind="m">
                  <cite class="user">
                   <a href="http://www.blogger.com/profile/12525620516837946733" rel="nofollow">
                    wirecutter
                   </a>
                  </cite>
                  <span class="icon user">
                  </span>
                 </div>
                 <p class="comment-content" id="bc_0_1MC">
                  I have learned more history from you than all the years I was supposed to be in school (and not out hunting or fishing).
                 </p>
                 <p class="comment-content">
                  ==============================
                  <br/>
                 </p>
                 I really must say, I like thousands of others have said, your blog is  the best out there  and with all of your history and experience, you should  run for
                 <b>
                  *president
                 </b>
                 . I look forward to reading your blog every day and  every day I learn from you. Thank you for the time you put into this  effort .
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 Sincerely,
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 Scott Fitts
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 <b>
                  *It would have to be an improvement. :) BT
                 </b>
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 ==============================
                 <br/>
                 <br/>
                 <div>
                  Hi Brock,
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                 <div dir="ltr">
                  Ever since I picked up on your blog I  "Knew" you were a "Gentleman of the South!"  You lack the "Crassness"  that is so prevalent in today's Sociopolitical arena but speak with the  Firmness in Truth and Conviction of Right like the words of our Late  Great President Jefferson Davis!  That is Honorable.
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                  I have been  thinking about this for a while now.   At first it was a very subtle  notice, then it became larger as I saw more.  Then it bloomed to me to be  what it is.  In your writings, in your Blog, Brock, "You" have written,  posted and done more to eradicate the "Revisionist History" forced on  us by the "Northern Aggressors,"BAR NONE!!!"  The "Stars and Bars"  fly High and Proud today even more thanks to your efforts!
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                  Reading  your post on 03 JUNE  about the birthday of President Jefferson Davis and  the "quotes" of his was the galvanizing  statement!  The first words  of "His" you posted say so much, are timeless and can never be  "Destroyed!" by any man!  .......and those words were........
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                 <div dir="ltr">
                  "Truth crushed to the earth is still truth still and like a seed will rise again."
                  <br/>
                  --Jefferson Davis (1808-1889)
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                 <div dir="ltr">
                  In  so many ways you and your efforts to keep and carry on the "Truth of  the South" are the water and light of the Sun that nourish "That Seed"  that Jefferson Davis speaks of! That "Seed" of "Southern Truth!"   That cannot be vanquished because of efforts like Men as yourself!
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                 <div dir="ltr">
                  Thanks for your selfless effort,
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                 <div dir="ltr">
                  The "Stars and Bars" FLY!
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                 <div dir="ltr">
                  Got gunz....OUTLAW?
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                 <div dir="ltr">
                  III%,
                  <br/>
                  <br/>
                 </div>
                 <div dir="ltr">
                  skybill-out
                 </div>
                 <br/>
                </div>
